marklogic.body:
Brian Cathcart's observation that we were "right on th edge" and that what we are seeing here is "Berlusconi without the prostitutes" was Spot on. And Chris Blackhurst is right to be anxious about what's going to come out of this.
I think Neville Thurlbeck's assessment of the Met' role in this scandal was naive. They didn't Act out of expediency. In my view they were, and still are,Â trying to conceal a much more culpable and sinister relationship with NI. Lord Stevens, Andy Hayman and John Yates were all unconvincing at Leveson, in my opinion. Last night's Panorama showing links between the controversial ex-Met commander Raymond Adams and NewsCorps company NDS could be just the beginning of further revelations of these links.
